text: in this video we are going to be

listen and read along in your head
sometimes in life things happen for a
reason good or bad it's all a matter of
your own perspective and the capability
of your own heart to find a meaning to
it all all the scars you might have from
any past experiences are only signs that
you can heal and grow no matter how
heartbroken or desperate you may be at
any given time if you will find it in
your heart to have a little bit of hope
you will eventually find it to sarah
every turmoil and problem that life gave
her was an infinite flow of experience
she could gain
now you read out loud by yourself
listen and read along in your head
she was only 25 but already had been
heartbroken many times
from the people that surrounded her from
the jobs she ever had from losses she
lived through but no matter what she
always found a way to smile at the world
and appreciate every day some people
would call her an optimist but to those
few that really knew sarah she was a
realist in the most blunt and
straightforward way that can ever be why
be sad over something that already
happened and can't be changed why cry
over someone who walked out of your life
now you read out loud by yourself
listen and read along in your head
why cry over someone who walked out of
your life to many her view of life would
seem cold-hearted and infuriating as if
she was incapable of feeling the
emotions that ruined everyone else's
lives to them she seemed weird or at
least a little unnerving though all she
really was only be called an open heart
sarah never closed herself to new
acquaintances or friends she could meet
in her life so she was a very sweet and
kind-hearted person
now you read out loud by yourself
listen and read along in your head
she could easily help a stranger or try
to make a child smile for no reason all
because she felt there was too much
sadness in the world and too many people
forgot what it really meant to be alive
and healthy capable of seeing the beauty
of everything around one of her favorite
spots to admire the world was a simple
park bench that stood under a very old
oak which gave shade during summer rain
golden leaves in autumn and winter it
offered a great snowy view and a
charming scent of blooming flowers when
spring came
now you read out loud by yourself
listen and read along in your head
whatever the weather may be this place
was always bringing a smile to sarah's
face
that day it was raining and sarah was
still enjoying her evening stroll
finishing it on the very same spot on
the bench where she could rest from the
hard working day in the office and clear
her head before going home this everyday
habit helped her see the world for what
it was and not for the terrible things
people wanted it to be when she felt
good she sings softly to the sounds of
wind and leaves rustling or the rain as
it was pouring down
now you read out loud by yourself
listen and read along in your head
having a very beautiful voice she never
followed her childhood dreams of
becoming a singer but still enjoyed
singing for her own pleasure every now
and again
and this day she was singing as the
raindrop spell onto her umbrella tapping
a melody on the material and bringing a
gentle smile on her lips
sarah watched the people hurrying to get
out of the rain and thought how sad it
was to see men and women forgetting to
notice the beauty of the silver drops
falling from the skies
now you read out loud by yourself
listen and read along in your head
for some time she sat on the bench
quietly singing until she realized that
she was not alone someone else's voice
joined in singing to the tune she turned
to see who it was and noticed a handsome
young man sitting on the bench that
stood on the other side of the path he
looked preoccupied and watching the
people around rather than watching her
and seemed to be enjoying the song she
was singing sarah didn't mind his
company even more so that he was
actually not even approaching her at all
now you read out loud by yourself
listen and read along in your head
a few minutes later as sarah finished
yet another song the man glanced at his
wristwatch and left without saying a
single word since that evening they saw
each other on those benches sarah coming
to the park a little earlier than the
man and he was always leaving before she
was but what warmed her heart was the
fact that he would always join in with
his pleasant baritone to make each song
even more beautiful it became a new
habit singing in a duet with the
stranger every day
now you read out loud by yourself
listen and read along in your head
and it made sarah happy to see him
whenever he joined her but one day he
didn't come and sarah found herself
wondering what could have happened to
the man if he wasn't there she waited
one day then another and when the week
passed she thought that he could have
probably moved somewhere else and they
will never see each other again sarah
didn't change her habit and still went
to that bench to sing dearly missing his
voice until one evening she suddenly
heard him again
now you read out loud by yourself
listen and read along in your head
this time though the man was not sitting
down on the bench across he walked right
up to her and sat next to sarah with a
charming smile on his handsome face they
finished the song together and he
finally greeted her i miss singing with
you here he said looking into her eyes
openly i'm sorry i was gone for so long
i must admit i missed hearing your voice
too sarah smiled back feeling her heart
warming up hi i'm william what do you
say we get coffee sometime
now you read out loud by yourself
